poem:
**The Whispered Urgency**

In the hushed heartbeat of the world,  
we stand on brittle edges—  
a chorus eager for change,  
yet veiled in solitary doubt.  
The earth, a patient listener,  
awaits our unspoken promises.  
One whispered action  
could shift the weight—  
a ripple through a million  
silent voices.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. More than two-thirds said they were willing to give 1% of their income to fight the climate crisis. Crucially, however, they thought only a minority of other people". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
